Key Arguments: The legislation is seen as a threat to freedom of speech.
It allegedly targets everyday Australians, independent media, and non-government political parties while protecting government and mainstream media.
The bill grants excessive powers to ACMA, allowing it to impose heavy fines on social media platforms.
The definition of misinformation is considered subjective and could be used to suppress legitimate criticism of the government.
The bill does not address misinformation from professional news outlets, which are excluded from its scope.
The legislation is viewed as a means to reinforce governmental and foreign influence over Australia's information space.
Notable Quotes: 'a license to censor' and is a direct attack on one of the fundamentals of our society, that being Freedom of Speech.
misinformation will mean whatever the government wants it to mean.
The passage of this bill will erode our democracy.
Lest we transpire into an Orwellian future where the 'Ministry of Truth' governs all!
